net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services

Class SimpleTestServiceConnection<S extends android.app.Service>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services.SimpleServiceConnection<S>
      • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services.SimpleTestServiceConnection<S>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ServiceConnection

    public class SimpleTestServiceConnection<S extends android.app.Service>
extends SimpleServiceConnection<S>
    Extends SimpleServiceConnection to provide connectivity to services within an Android test case. This is not a test suite in itself; rather, it provides a feature which may be used in tests.
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.1.2 (#3)

      • connectTest

        public SimpleTestServiceConnection<S> connectTest(android.support.test.rule.ServiceTestRule rule,
                                                  int bmFlags)
                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                  java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        As SimpleServiceConnection.connect(Context,int), but with a ServiceTestRule instead of a Context as the context in which the connection occurs.
        Parameters:
        rule - a service test rule to facilitate the binding
        bmFlags - a mask of optional binding flags; see Context
        Returns:
        the connection, for fluid invocations
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the rule is null
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if the binding times out

      • connect

        public SimpleTestServiceConnection<S> connect(android.content.Context ctx,
                                              int bmFlags)
        Description copied from class: SimpleServiceConnection
        Attempts to connect to the service. The caller should not process the return value of this method immediately in order to access the service; rather, it should handle the consequences of the connection by implementing SimpleServiceConnection.Listener.onServiceConnected(net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services.SimpleServiceConnection<LS>).
        Overrides:
        connect in class SimpleServiceConnection<S extends android.app.Service>
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context in which to bind to the service
        bmFlags - a mask of optional binding flags; see Context
        Returns:
        the connection, for fluid invocations

      • connect

        public SimpleTestServiceConnection<S> connect(android.content.Context ctx)
        Description copied from class: SimpleServiceConnection
        Attempts to connect to the service, using the default binding control flags. The caller should not process the return value of this method immediately in order to access the service; rather, it should handle the consequences of the connection by implementing SimpleServiceConnection.Listener.onServiceConnected(net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services.SimpleServiceConnection<LS>).
        Overrides:
        connect in class SimpleServiceConnection<S extends android.app.Service>
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context in which to bind to the service
        Returns:
        the connection, for fluid invocations
        See Also:
        SimpleServiceConnection.DEFAULT_BINDING_FLAGS

      • disconnect

        public SimpleTestServiceConnection<S> disconnect(android.content.Context ctx)
        Description copied from class: SimpleServiceConnection
        Attempts to break the connection to the service. Methods that tear down the context in which the service was started (such as Activity.onStop()) should call this method to free the service binding. The caller should not assume that the binding was successfully released; any other consequences of releasing this binding should be handled by implementing SimpleServiceConnection.Listener.onServiceDisconnected(net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services.SimpleServiceConnection<LS>).
        Overrides:
        disconnect in class SimpleServiceConnection<S extends android.app.Service>
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context in which the binding should be broken
        Returns:
        the connection, for fluid invocations
